content.body: no, not the intention that it's normative

content.body: liveness is defined on sets of objects

content.body: Ashley Claymore: that does seem like a bug of sorts; you shouldn't have requirements in notes; notes should be statements of fact, or discuss some context or some such

content.body: the note is clarifying that this clearing operation is on sets of objects, not individual objects
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the note is clarifying that this clearing operation is on sets of objects, not individual objects

content.body: it's in there because a previous formulation was liveness was buggy in that way

content.body: The bit Iâ€™m missing is that there doesnâ€™t seem to be a requirement for what is in the set
that's defined in liveness, the two bullet points

content.body: there is no requirement on the size of that set

content.body: it is as compliant to never clear any objects as it is to always clear the maximal set of non-live objects

content.body: shu: I'd rephrase the "must" bits as statements of fact then, this is reading as separate requirements
